content.name: html_1
content.content:
Welcome

Kent County Council Care Navigators Feedback App!

Care Navigators work across Kent with people who are over 50 years old and want to stay independent in their own home. When people have received support from Care Navigators, it is important that we ask their views on the help they have received. This helps us to develop and improve the service.

Please answer the following questions, if you require additional support to complete the questions then speak to the Care Navigator and they will be able to help or provide you with the questions in an alternative format.
Your answers will be completely anonymous

To begin the survey please select the button below.

content.name: html_12
content.content: What did the Care Navigator help you with?

content.name: html_10
content.content:
Thank you!

Your Care Navigator Survey has been successfully submitted.

Thank you for taking the time to complete our survey, we truly value the information you have provided.

Please select the finish button below to return to the homepage.

content.name: html_11
content.content:
Privacy Notice

1. Background

Kent County Council is working with its partners to turn around the lives of families with multiple needs. Therefore, relevant personal data of individuals and families may be shared with partner agencies to ensure that the support offered meets their needs.

The information that will be shared may relate to:

  • Housing needs
  • Health needs
  • Crime and anti-social behaviour
  • Adults out of work or at risk of financial exclusion
  • Older and vulnerable people who need help
  • Families affected by domestic violence and abuse
    1. Care needs
    2. Support needs

2. How we are using your information?

The information gathered may be shared with partners so that we can work together in a joined up way or for research purposes (including the impact of the national study of our services). However, any reports by the research organisation will only contain anonymised information which means that it will be impossible for anyone to identify the families.

3. How will this affect me?

The data used for research will not affect the benefits, services or treatment families/individuals receive.

4. Why is my information being shared?

We are sharing your information to help improve the services you and your family, and other families receive now and in the future.

5. How we keep your information safe?

KCC keeps information about you secure and there are strict controls on who can see your information.

6. Need to know more about how we process your information?

If you would like to get a copy of the information we hold or share about you, Please contact:
Information Resilience & Transparency Team, Room 2.71, Sessions House, Maidstone, Kent, ME14 1XQ or Email: dataprotection@kent.gov.uk.
